New York University Archives
Holmes Condict Jackson Laboratory Manual
Jackson, Holmes Condict, 1875-
MC.85
0.25 Linear Feet in 1 folder in shared half manuscript box
1917 Holmes Condict Jackson (1875-1927) was a professor of physiology and director of the laboratory of physiology at University and Bellevue Medical College, New York University. He was the author of Manual of Physiological Chemistry and Laboratory Exercises in Physiology. The Holmes Condict Jackson Laboratory Manual consists of Laboratory Exercises in Physiology, 1917, published by New York University Press. The manual was intended for medical students and contains diagrams and instructions on the apparatuses used for various experiments, instructions on how to write reports, and instructions for the experiments themselves.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
Biographical Note
Holmes Condict Jackson (1875-1927) was a professor of physiology and director of the laboratory of physiology at University and Bellevue Medical College, New York University. He was the author of Manual of Physiological Chemistry and Laboratory Exercises in Physiology.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Holmes Condict Jackson Laboratory Manual; MC 85; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Materials were most likely removed from a binder, then placed in a new acid-free folder and box at an unknown date.
Scope and Contents
The Holmes Condict Jackson Laboratory Manual consists of Laboratory Exercises in Physiology, 1917, published by New York University Press. The manual was intended for medical students and contains diagrams and instructions on the apparatuses used for various experiments, instructions on how to write reports, and instructions for the experiments themselves.
